channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Behind the glitz in Milan, the Epstein scandal casts its shadow over the Olympic movement
item.description: The Epstein scandal has spread to the Olympic movement. The top organizer of the Los Angeles Summer Games faces calls to step down because of his past...

item.title: TB or not TB? That is the question
item.description: A new study in "Nature Medicine" estimates 2 million people are incorrectly told they have TB each year — and clinicians miss diagnosing TB in 1 milli...

item.title: It's about to get easier for Trump to fire federal workers
item.description: Since his first term, President Trump has wanted to be able to fire federal employees for any reason. A new rule vastly expands his authority to do th...

item.title: Congress passes $50 billion foreign aid bill, despite the Trump's cuts in 2025
item.description: Congress allocated $50 billion for initiatives aimed at supporting democracy, scholarship programs, U.S. embassy operations and health and humanitaria...

item.title: Hate them or not, Patriots fans want the glory back in Super Bowl LX
item.description: As Bostonians bemoan their long years of suffering without a Super Bowl win, rival fans gripe that Title Town has become Entitled Town.

item.title: Suspect in 2012 Benghazi attack arrested and brought to the U.S.
item.description: The FBI has arrested "one of the key participants" behind the attack on U.S. facilities in Benghazi, Libya, in 2012 that killed four Americans.

item.title: Fear in Minnesota’s Somali community deepens, hampering progress on measles vaccination
Fisherman fleeing elephants killed by crocodile in Zambia
item.description: The fisherman ran into a stream near the river after he and two friends encountered a herd of elephants.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s demand for mom’s ‘proof of life’ is complicated in this era of AI and deepfakes
2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony live updates
item.description: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony officially kicks off the Milano-Cortina Games with performances, the Parade of Nations and the lighting of t...

item.title: Where the investigation on Nancy Guthrie's disappearance stands
item.description: Savannah Guthrie's brother, Camron, made another plea to their mother's potential abductors as authorities continue their search for the 84-year-old w...

item.title: Amazon shares fall as it joins Big Tech AI spending spree
item.description: Major firms collectively announce $650bn worth of investment in AI this week, rattling investors.

item.title: What the U.S. and Iran want from nuclear talks in Oman
item.description: The U.S. and Iran are wrapping up indirect talks in Oman Friday over Tehran's nuclear program. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer ...

item.title: Iranian foreign minister says US talks in Oman a 'good beginning'
item.description: Abbas Aragchi says there will be consultations, after hours of talks end in Muscat, which both sides entered with significantly different positions.

item.title: Americans weigh in on state of the economy in new CBS News poll
item.description: Americans weighed in on the jobs front, prices and economic opportunities in a CBS News poll released this week. Olivia Rinaldi shares some takeaways.

item.title: More than 30 killed in blast at Pakistan mosque, officials say
item.description: Almost 170 were injured in the explosion, which took place during Friday prayers in the capital Islamabad.

item.title: Watch: Ukrainian soldier thought to be dead calls his family
item.description: Nazar Daletskyi's relatives were told he had been killed in 2022, the first year of Russia’s full-scale invasion.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s family renews plea to mother’s kidnapper, while sheriff says they have no suspect
item.description: The family of “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie is renewing their plea for their mother’s kidnapper to contact them.
